--- title: "DACSS 603 Homework 2" author: "Laura Collazo" description: "Homework 2 for DASS 603." date: "2023-03-17" format: html: toc: true code-fold: true code-copy: true code-tools: true categories: - hw2 - desriptive statistics - probability --- # Libraries ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(kableExtra) ``` ::: # Question 1 The data for the first question is shown below. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} surgical_procedure <- c("Bypass", "Angiography") sample_size <- c(539, 847) mean_wait_time <- c(19, 18) standard_deviation <- c(10, 9) data <- data.frame(surgical_procedure, sample_size, mean_wait_time, standard_deviation) kable(data) %>% kable_styling() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
surgical_procedure sample_size mean_wait_time standard_deviation
Bypass 539 19 10
Angiography 847 18 9
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} confidence_level <- 0.90 ``` ::: The 90% confidence interval for the actual mean wait time for patients receiving a bypass is: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # calculate confidence interval for "Bypass" bypass_se <- 10 / sqrt(539) bypass_tail <- (1-confidence_level)/2 bypass_t <- qt(p = 1 - bypass_tail, df = 539 -1) bypass_ci <- c(19 - bypass_t * bypass_se, 19 + bypass_t * bypass_se) bypass_ci ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 18.29029 19.70971 ``` ::: ::: The 90% confidence interval for the actual mean wait time for patients receiving an angiography is: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # calculate confidence interval for "Angiography" angi_se <- 9 / sqrt(847) angi_tail <- (1-confidence_level)/2 angi_t <- qt(p = 1 - angi_tail, df = 847 -1) angi_ci <- c(18 - angi_t * angi_se, 18 + angi_t * angi_se) angi_ci ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 17.49078 18.50922 ``` ::: ::: The confidence interval is narrower for the angiography. # Question 2 The data for question two is shown below. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sample_size2 <- 1031 voted_yes <- 567 voted_no <- (sample_size2 - voted_yes) data2 <- data.frame(sample_size2, voted_yes, voted_no) kable(data2) %>% kable_styling() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
sample_size2 voted_yes voted_no
1031 567 464
````` ::: ::: The point estimate, p, for the proportion of all adult Americans who believe a college education is essential for success is: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} p <- voted_yes/sample_size2 p ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 0.5499515 ``` ::: ::: A 95% confidence interval for p is: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} margin_of_error <- qnorm(0.975) * sqrt(p*(1-p)/sample_size2) low <- p - margin_of_error low ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 0.5195839 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} high <- p + margin_of_error high ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 0.5803191 ``` ::: ::: What this tells us is at the 95% confidence interval between 51.95839% and 58.03191% of the population of adult Americans would believe a college education is essential for success. # Question 3 ::: {.cell} ::: # Question 4 ::: {.cell} ::: # Question 5 ::: {.cell} ::: # Question 6 ::: {.cell} ::: # Question 7 ::: {.cell} :::
